definition: babbling nonsense (idiom); crazy and unfounded ravings/double Dutch
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
surname Hu
words/speech/to say/to talk
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
dialect/language/speech
to tell to

sentences.english: These nonsense letter, they are only the night-blooming cereus blossom from the fingertip.
sentences.chinese: 這些胡言亂語的文字，它們只是指尖開出的曇花。

sentences.english: During his fever he babbled without stopping.
sentences.chinese: 他在發燒時不停地胡言亂語。

sentences.english: A lot of his talk sounded like the ravings of a madman.
sentences.chinese: 他說的大部分話聽着就像是個瘋子的胡言亂語。

sentences.english: And some said, What will this babbler say?
sentences.chinese: 有的說，這胡言亂語的要說什麼。

sentences.english: It's been an orgy of nonsense that Malaysia can ill afford.
sentences.chinese: 它的是一個喧鬧的宴會，胡言亂語，馬國可負擔不起。

sentences.english: He was raving like a lunatic. We all heard him, didn't we?
sentences.chinese: 他像個瘋子一樣胡言亂語。我們都聽到了，是嗎？

sentences.english: But there is too little gold and too much drivel .
sentences.chinese: 但是寶貴的東西太少，胡言亂語太多。

sentences.english: I'm fed up with all those nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 所有那些胡言亂語我真聽膩了。

sentences.english: The fact that it is bollocks hasn’t stopped a good many people from believing in it.
sentences.chinese: 事實是胡言亂語並沒有阻止人們去相信它。

sentences.english: These words of nonsense, are only the night-blooming cereus.
sentences.chinese: 這些胡言亂語的文字，它們只是指尖開出的曇花。

sentences.english: Five years ago, that question would have been gibberish.
sentences.chinese: 5年前，這個問題簡直就是胡言亂語。

sentences.english: Because of his high fever, the sick man raved all night.
sentences.chinese: 由於高燒，病人胡言亂語了一晚上。

sentences.english: And some said, What will this baler say?
sentences.chinese: 有的說，這胡言亂語的要說什麼。

sentences.english: The cloud of spectators followed, jestIng, In a paroxysm of delight.
sentences.chinese: 一大羣觀衆，樂到發狂，嘴裏胡言亂語，都跟着走。

sentences.english: All that academic rigmarole was a waste of time.
sentences.chinese: 所有的理論上的胡言亂語都是浪費時間。

definition: to interrupt (sb speaking)/interruption/digression
handicapped person/useless person
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
to stop breathing/to breathe one's last/to die/to cut the gas supply
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
to abuse roundly
billowing smoke (idiom)/foul atmosphere/(fig.) murky atmosphere/in a turmoil
to damn/to curse/to revile
half-awake/half-asleep
to explain/to justify/to defend (a point of view etc)/to provide an explanation/to try to defend oneself
daydream/reverie
incoherent speech/to talk without rhyme or reason (idiom)
to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
Zen saying repeated as cant/(fig.) catchphrase/mantra/favorite expression/stock phrase
